title: Business & Finance
text:
Top shareholders said they would vote against re-electing key Credit Suisse board members following the bank's $5.5 billion loss from Archegos.

---

Apple said it would build a new campus and engineering hub in North Carolina as part of a series of investments planned in the U.S. over the next five years.

---

The Nasdaq rose 0.9% to close at its first record since February. The S&P 500 added 0.2%, also setting a record. The Dow slipped 0.2%.

---

China is investigating Meituan over suspected antitrust practices, the latest move by Beijing to tighten its grip on the country's tech industry.

---

Durable-goods orders resumed growth in March as the U.S. recovery stoked manufacturing demand that has been building since last fall.

---

Lyft is selling its self-driving division to a Toyota unit for $550 million, saying the sale will help it turn a profit sooner than previously expected.

---

Google secured a cloud-computing contract with Spanish-language broadcaster Univision that could be valued at more than $1 billion over eight years.

---

ABC's broadcast of the Academy Awards ceremony drew 9.85 million viewers, making it the least-watched Oscars show on record.
